parameters: A large group of Harpies surround you.
Looks like it'll be one of those fights.
You've defeated the Harpy horde. Return to the Mayor now.
Inform him of your victory.
A lone Harpy greets you at the entrance.
She's got a... collar on?
The name on the collar is "Polly".
Usually Harpies don't like to be considered pets...
Harpy
Polly
*SQUAWK* "Polly is here to negotiate!"
*BRAAWK!* "What are your terms, human?"
*SQUAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAWK!*
You stare at the Harpy.
This is NOT normal, even for the bird-people.
Polly notices your reaction and explains.
Harpy
Polly
*BRAAWK!* "Polly likes being a parrot!"
"...Is that OK?"
The last sentence was said in a very pleading tone.
It was nothing like the previous sentences.
You assure her you've seen weirder.
You then state the Mayor's terms.
Harpy
Polly
*BRAWWK!* This is unreasonable!
*SQUAWK!* "Mayor will use this to hurt us!"
*BRAWWK!* "But we will be agree to it!"
*SQUAWK!* "Only to be there for our friends!"
Harpy
Polly
"...Especially.. the... Slimes..."
*Squawlllk*
"Tell Gate... I said hi..."
You thank Polly, and she flies away.
As you watch her graceful form slowly disappear...
You wonder what she meant about the Mayor.
He would never abuse his power like that, right?
And how in the world does she know Gate?
Polly flies toward you, rage in her eyes.
She's screeching at top of her lungs a single word:
Gate.
Behind her follow a swarm of harpies. Oh no.
A young harpy female flies toward you, screaming.
Is she saying... gate? No, you must be mishearing.
Or maybe gate is some war cry of hers, whatever.
You ready your sword as more harpies come out to face you.
The last Harpy warrior falls to the ground.
No time to celebrate... or mourn.
You have to get to the Minotaur Camp, quick!
Hopefully Nebula is satisified with these kills...
There are 9 hours until the Blood Moon.
Polly had fascinated you in your prior encounter.
So, as any curious person would, you go to see her.
You arrive at the Harpy's Nest and ask the guards for her.
They stare at you as if you've grown a second head.
After a few moments, one of the veterans snaps out of it.
She nudges the rookie next to her and points to the nest.
The rookie starts and flies off, hopefully to get Polly.
The rest of the guards slowly start to wake up too.
A few - rather awkward - minutes go by before the return.
Polly warily trails behind the rookie as the two descend.
As soon as she sees you, however, her eyes light up.
She dives toward you, stopping moments before she'd crash.
Harpy
Polly
*BRAWK!* "Polly remembers you, remembers you!"
*SQUAWK!* "You're the nice, nice diplomat!"
*BWORK!* "How can Polly help you, friend?"
*SQUWARK! BRAWK! SQUAWK!*
The other harpies around you two make awkward glances.
Polly must seem like a sort of embarrassment to them.
Despite this, she's still managed to keep a leader role.
To you, that speaks volumes on her skill.
You explain to Polly that you're curious about Harpies.
You want to learn of their culture, and how she fits in it.
Polly suddenly gets shy and starts preening herself.
She refuses to make eye contact as she speaks.
Harpy
Polly
*Squerrk* "Oh, you do?" *Squawwk* "Really?"
*Brerwk* "I'm..." *Squawk* "Surprised..."
*Brawk* "Most people just look at me funny..."
*Rawrk* "Or even mock and ridicule me..."
You explain to Polly that parroting is just her quirk.
Everyone has a quirk or two, and hers is just more obvious.
The fact she owns it despite the ridicule is what draws you.
She is her genuine self, no matter what others say or do.
Harpy
Polly
*Bwerrk* "Th-Thank you, adventurer."
*Squawk* "I wish I had time to help you..."
*Brawk* "But maybe come here after dark?"
*Brorwk* "I get off duty after sunset."
You agree, and head home for the day.
Despite not having learned much, you're glad you came.
Polly really seems to need someone who understands her.
You wonder how many of her kind look at her like the guards.
You arrive just as the last of the sun's rays disappear.
Cloaked in darkness, you hear a familiar squawking noise.
It's coming from the guard post, and as you get closer...
You hear Polly finishing up her report to the next shift.
Harpy
Polly
*Squawk!* "And all's quiet on the west front!"
*Brawk!* "Any questions, soldier?"
*Squerk!* "No? Then it's all yours, friend."
*BRAWK!*
As you watch the exchange, you realize something...
Even with her odd mannerisms, Polly has a presence of sorts.
A pressence that commands respect and trust, no matter what.
The torchlight dances on her beautiful feathers.
Harpy
Polly
"Are you ready for-" *BRAWK!* "Our outing?"
*Her back is still turned.*
*SQUAWK!* "Don't think I didn't see you there!"
*BRARWK!* "I can sense when I'm being watched."
This makes you start a little, but you quickly recover.
Following Polly further into the nest, you pick her brain.
You ask her how the hierarchy works in her society.
Where are all the male Harpies? What is their place?
Harpy
Polly
*BRAWK!* "Curious one, aren't you? Good."
*SQUAWK!* "I like curious people."
*BRARWK!* "They're usually highly intelligent."
*SQUARWK!* "Now, on to the questions..."
Harpy
Polly
*SQUAWK!* "Harpies were once nomads."
*BRAWK!* "When the Dragon King took over..."
*BWORK!* "He gave us this island to live in."
*SQUARWK!* "We're still kinda figuring it out."
Harpy
Polly
*SQUALK!* "We currently have three matriarchs."
*SQUARWK!* "One for each faction of Harpies."
*BRARWK!* "The Diadees live in pure democracy."
*WARWK!* "All adults vote and majority rules."
Harpy
Polly
*BWARK!* "Then there's the Socas. An odd one."
*BRAWK!* "They live in selfishness."
*SQUAWK!* "They live in the outskirts..."
*SQUARWK!* "And all crime is legal for them."
Harpy
Polly
*SQUARWK!* "Their Matriarch is a figurehead."
*BRAWK!* "She's only there to make sure..."
*BRAWRK!* "Her people can keep the lifestyle."
*SQUAWK!* "And then there's my faction..."
Harpy
Polly
*SQUARWK!* "We call ourselve the Poes."
*BWARK!* "We are a Monarchy... kinda."
*KWARK!* "Yes, our Matriarch rules..."
*BRAWK!* "And yes, her eldest CAN take over."
Harpy
Polly
*SQAWLK! "However, if the child is unfit..."
*BRAWLK!* "She will be banished..."
*SQUAWK!* "And the next ranking family down..."
*BRAWK!* "Will take the throne instead."
Harpy
Polly
*SQUAWK!* "The three Monarchs work together."
*BRAWK!* "They represent their peoples..."
*SQUARK!* "And come to agreements together..."
*BWARK!* "On things that affect all of us."
Harpy
Polly
*BRAWK!* "So, that's that question."
*SQUAWLK!* "It's almost morning, now."
*BWARK!* "We'll have to answer the second..."
*BRAWK!* "At another time."
You nod, though you wish you could hear more.
You do know how tired you are and how Polly must feel.
You tell her one last thing before you go, however:
She looks really beautiful with the dawn rays on her.
Polly blushes, and blows you a flirtatious kiss as you go.
You blow another back, and head home.
You're not sure what had compelled you to make that move.
You're very glad you did, though. You feel so light.
You arrive back at the nest at the same time as before.
You see Polly and another leuitenant saluting each other.
They then part ways and Polly takes off her helmet.
She has just finished her report, it seems.
Harpy
Polly
*SQUAWK!* "I know you're there, pretty-face!"
*BRAWK!* "Pretty-face! Pretty-face!"
*SQUWARK!* "I know your scent and sounds now."
*BRARWK!* How can I help you, pretty-face?"
You're look at Polly adoringly and walk up to her.
You call her pretty bird and stroke her soft feathers.
She coos but then stands straight and tall, looking around.
Something had caught her attention, but what?
Harpy
Polly
"WE'RE UNDER ATTACK! GUNPOWDER! GUNPOWDER!"
*Polly flies up and grabs you in her talons*
*She whisks you away to safety in the nest*
*She then takes a whistle out and blows.
You see a canonball hit a guardpost...
It's the same one you had just been with Polly at.
Harpy troops are already starting to get into formation.
You look up to see a large, flying ship. Sky pirates!
Harpy
Polly
"5th Battalion, take out those cannons!"
"Seventh Battalion, keep the small ships away!"
"MOVE IT, PEOPLE! MOVE! MOVE! MOVE!"
*She continues to bark orders at Harpy troops.*
The battle looks like chaos in the sky above the Harpy nest.
You wish you could do something to help, but...
But wait, maybe there IS something you can do!
You watch as small, one-man skyships fly past your hideout.
You wait for the perfect moment, position yourself...
And JUMP!
You fall a good three yards before landing.
You yank out the pilot of the skyship.
You jump in the cockpit and start shooting at the others.
Confused, the skyships start shooting each other...
Over the radio, you hear pilots yelling about a rogue ship.
You hatch a devious idea and grab the radio.
You tell the others that you spotted the rogue ship!
It went behind the nest, and might be trying to escape!
You watch as all the pilots fly away from the mothership.
The Harpies see this, not knowing what's going on.
However, they aren't going to waste this opportunity.
As the smaller ships duked it out in a free-for-all...
The Harpies converge on the mothership.
You watch as Polly leads a charge to the ship.
Guns go off and feathers fly as the Harpies attack.
They grab crew members from the deck and throw them off.
You watch as Polly throws a feisty one into the abyss.
As he falls, though, you see him loading his musket...
AND AIMING IT RIGHT AT POLLY! You don't even think twice...
You careen your ship into the falling crew member.
It knocks his aim off, so he doesn't hit Polly's heart.
...Instead, he hits her wing.
She falls out of the sky, letting out a terrible squawk.
She tries desperately to steady herself, but can't!
You force your ship into a nose-dive, aiming for her.
You think fast, knowing that even if she lands in the pit...
She's going too fast, and would just go splat.
As you approach her, you get an idea.
You dip far below her. Just barely within sight.
You turn your thrusters up toward the sky, and her.
If this doesn't work, well, she was going to die anyway.
You fire them at max heat and minimal thrust.
You're still falling, but slower than Polly at this point.
As she gets nearer, her feathers catch the hot air.
She slows down a little, then a little more, and more...
You see the ground below you. It's now or never.
You right the ship and open the cockpit...
Just long enough for Polly to land on top of you.
You're dazed, as she had definitely still been going fast.
You close the cockpit and try your best to aim the ship up.
Darkness surrounds you right before the crash...
Ooohhh... your head is pounding. Everything hurts.
...Are you dead? Is this the Underworld?
You know you mess up sometimes, soo... maybe this is it?
You realize your eyes are closed. You open them.
You're inside an infirmary. A Harpy infirmary.
You look to the side. Polly is laying next to you.
Her eyes are closed, and she looks pretty beaten up.
You hold your breath, watch, and listen. She's breathing.
A long sigh of relief comes out of you.
A Harpy nurse, who was treating a nearby patient, jumps.
She turns to you, wide-eyed. You guess you'd been out a bit.
You weakly ask her if Polly will survive.
Harpy
Harpy Nurse
"Polly? Oh, yes, she'll be OK. Full recovery."
"Might need some physical therapy, though."
"But you... How are you alive!?"
"Your chest was pierced by a metal bar!"
A metal bar!? Chest pierced!? You look down...
The left side of your chest is bandaged and bloody.
You can feel metal where a few ribs used to be.
Your find that breathing deeply hurts your left side, too.
Harpy
Harpy Nurse
"Your bruised lung and missing ribs?"
"You mean to tell me you don't care about-"
"Dear, YOUR HEART IS LITERALLY MISSING!"
"Are you a zombie? A mutant? Mutant zombie?
A missing heart? But it hit your left side, not - Oh.
Right. Normal people stuff, haha. You weakly explain:
You were born with your heart on the right of your chest.
The nurse sits down, looking pale.
Harpy
Harpy Nurse
"You do know how lucky you are, right?"
*Her voice is shaky and she looks like death*
"The metal went right through where..."
"Where your heart should be..."
Harpy
Harpy Nurse
"The doctors only patched you up so you..."
"So you'd be presentable during the funeral."
"We didn't expect - we thought you were dead."
"Oh, Matriarch preserve my soul..."
Harpy
Harpy Nurse
"You should be dead three times over."
"First from the fall... second from the bar..."
"And third from any possible autopsy!"
"We told the morgue it was unnecessary!"
As she talks you start to feel lightheaded.
You pass out again, and when you wake, you're in your house.
A human nurse is now taking care of you.
She stays with you for a few months until you recover.
As soon as you're able, you ride out to see Polly.
You want to make sure the nurse was right. If she made it.
It's midday, so she should be working, right?
But... she's not at her post when you arrive.
You ask one of the guards if they'd seen her.
The guard tells you that she hasn't fully recovered yet.
Rumors say that Polly's injuries seem healed...
But she is still unable to fly, making her unworthy to lead.
You know that the only way into the nest is through flight.
You beg the guard to take you to see Polly.
The guard is hesitant at first, but eventually says yes.
She tells you, though, that if people notice she left...
...Your head will be mounted on a pike in her living room.
You gulp, and tell her that won't be necessary.
You'll tell the guards she's taking you to the higher-ups.
Secret diplomat stuff, see?
She nods, and takes you into the nest. Your bluff works.
She leaves you at the entrance, and you start looking.
Perhaps she's still in the infirmary? You know where it is.
You and Polly had passed it in your first tour of the place.
You make your way there, and enter once more.
It reeks of death, blood, and various other nasty things.
You hadn't noticed the stench last time you were there.
Perhaps you'd been there so long you'd gone noseblind?
You shake your head. Not important. Polly is the goal.
You look around for any familiar faces. Nothing.
Most of the injured Harpies seem to be dying.
None of them looked like Polly at all.
You spot someone walking between the rows of patients.
The Harpy nurse from before! Maybe she knows!
You approach her as noisily as you can.
You don't want to spook her, knowing how timid she can be.
Harpy
Harpy Nurse
"Oh! You're back, and... no longer injured!"
"I guess you're looking for Polly, right?"
"She was sent home months ago."
"I'm not allowed to give away her location..."
Harpy
Harpy Nurse
"...But I can tell you one thing."
"I think you should get a cup of coffee."
"The shop is halfway back toward the entrance."
"And the nest-house across from it is 'fun.'"
She smiles, winking at you. You thank her profusely.
Leaving, you decide to go get your "coffee..."
And maybe check out that "fun-looking" house while there.
You exit the room and head back the way you came.
You make your way back, seeking the shop. Then you spot it.
A small cafe labeled "Harpy Happy-Times."
You recognize a guard through the window, though.
You had told them the lie of "secret diplomat stuff."
Across from the cafe is a small Harpy's house-nest.
Harpies make houses out of sticks and other random things.
It's an old tradition from when they were just large birds.
Before humans started experiments that resulted in...
Well, let's just say magic was involved and no more.
You shudder when you remember the pictures you saw.
Pictures of exactly what experiments went on at the time.
You snap your mind back into the present.
The guards didn't see you. At least, you hoped they didn't.
You'd have a LOT of explaining to do if they saw you.
Sneaking into the nest, convincing a guard to leave post...
Both were considered crimes to Harpies.
You watch the guard. She gets up, and you dart away.
Hiding behind a corner, you watch her walk back to her post.
You then see her stop and turn toward Polly's house.
She yells loudly in the nest-house's direction:
Harpy
Guard
"POLLY! YOUR LOVER IS HERE TO VISIT YOU!"
*She turns and looks directly at you*
"You really think we bought that shlang?"
"Pff, humans."
Your face turns red. Of course, hightened smell and hearing.
Harpies can tell you're lying from six feet away.
They smell your stress hormones increase and heart speed up.
Naturally hunters of the night, only vegan by choice.
You don't even bother hiding yourself anymore.
You step out and walk to Polly's nest-house.
She opens the door before you can even knock.
No signs are left of her injuries, but her stare...
She looks... tired. Not of lack of sleep, though.
There are no dark circles under her eyes, but she's aged.
Her demeanor is that of a hardened veteran now.
She'd knocked at death's door, and barely escaped his grasp.
Harpy
Polly
*Her tone is emotionless as she speaks:*
"Why are you here?"
*Her words are biting and cold*
"Were you sent to talk to me?"
You look at her, shocked. You thought she'd be happy.
You ask her if she remembers you. She nods.
She stays expressionless as you tell her why you came.
You're getting a little annoyed at this point.
You had saved her life, almost died for her...
She could at least show a bit of gratitude, right?
You want to call her out on it, but you stop yourself.
Maybe there's a reason for this? You ask her.
Harpy
Polly
"I honestly thought you would have known."
"...Or at least figured it out by now."
"I can smell gunpowder, and loading a musket?"
"Not only does it make a sound..."
Harpy
Polly
"It fills the air with the stench of powder..."
"And metal from the bullet."
"If I had wanted to, I would have dodged it."
"You get it now?"
You process all that you just heard. She...
She didn't want to dodge the bullet? Aimed at her chest?
She didn't want to be saved after she got hit?
The look on your face shows her that you finally understand.
Harpy
Polly
"There you go. I do appreciate the effort."
"...But you've only made my life even harder."
"I used to think I couldn't get lower."
"That was wrong. NOW it can't get any worse."
Was this the same Polly? The one who had, only months ago...
Been flirting with you and acting as her parrot self?
Was this the same Polly who had led those battalions?
Had she just been hiding it this whole time?
Harpy
Polly
"You know my name isn't Polly, right?"
"I adopted the name for my parrot side."
"Right now I'm too exhausted of life, though."
"The parrot's not coming out to play."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"My real name is Pauline."
"The whole spiral started when I lost..."
"When I lost the love of my life."
"And it's just been downhill ever since."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"They're not dead. That'd be too easy on me."
"They just... stopped loving me."
"Like I was some doll they got tired of."
"I guess I'm worth about as much, to be fair."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"You know, I heard once something about this."
"About people who are ready to off themselves."
"They said that their lives?"
"Their lives seem to magically get better."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"That they seem to be happier and happier."
"And when it looks like they've now recovered?"
"That's the day they kill themselves."
"They weren't happy with their lives, in fact."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"...They were just excited to be rid of it."
"But now? I have no energy for it."
"I don't have a plan. My brain is too fogged."
"I can barely think, or eat, or do anything."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"I just lay in bed most days, a lazy bum."
"I'm to tired to lift my wings and fly."
"I'm too tired to be alive."
"I haven't drunk any water in three days."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"I haven't eaten food in a week."
"And I don't miss it. I just want to die."
"I'm just going to starve here, waiting."
"Waiting for my body to give up."
Pauline... no, Polly. You refuse to think of her that way.
She needs help. You know she does. But... what can you do?
You feel powerless, staring into her soulless eyes.
How do you save someone who does not wish to be saved?
You know the answer. It tears at your heart and mind.
You don't want to admit you know. You want to help her.
But the answer is simple: You don't. They need to want help.
Otherwise, you can try all you want, but all in vain.
Finally, you speak. Your voice is ragged, your heart broken.
You can barely get the words out in between breaths.
You can't think. You feel the need to do or say SOMETHING.
YOU NEED TO HELP HER! YOU NEED TO FIX THIS!
Your words slowly form sentences as you speak.
Polly, Gate misses you.
They would be devastated if they found out about... this.
Please, drink some water. Eat something. Get help.
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"Gate... No. You lie. They deserted me."
"They left me, calling me immature."
"Telling me to 'grow up' before anything else."
"I'm a broken, used, tool. A disgusting thing."
So much for that attempt. You try again, desperate now.
Your words come out like ice:
You die, I die.
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"Wh-What? No, you're bluffing."
*She finally shows some emotion: concern*
"But... your scent isn't off."
"Your heartbeat is stable..."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"...You do mean it. Fine.
"I'll do what you say. Only for you..."
"Only because the world needs you... my sweet."
"AND only until you get over me and leave."
Harpy
Polly
"Don't try to say anything to change my mind."
"I'm trash, to be discared into flames."
"But I guess I may as well enjoy the ride."
"Since, well, I can't do anything else."
You stay with Polly a few days to make sure she survives.
When you leave, she kisses your cheek and smiles a little.
Her first smile you'd seen since the attack.
She promises to seek medical and emotional help.
It's been a few weeks, now, since Polly promised recovery.
You've visited a few times, and she's been making progress.
You decide to bring her some flowers today: Poppies.
You've always liked how calming poppy flowers are.
You enter her house and she greets you warmly.
The two of you kiss passionately and talk for a bit.
Polly still doesn't go parrot mode anymore. You miss it.
It was silly, yes, but also it seemed more... genuine.
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"Something's on your mind, baby-cheeks."
"What's wrong? Come on, you can tell me."
*She listens to you as you explain*
"You're not wrong to feel that way. It's me."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"Pauline feels like a mask I don when needed."
"Like, for example, in battle."
"Or, like now, when in recovery."
"I know it probably doesn't make sense to you."
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"I do appreciate how, despite not parroting..."
"You still call me by my true name."
"Legalities aside, It's only actually me..."
"When I'm Polly the Parrot."
You suggest, perhaps, when she recovers... a name change?
She giggles, nodding her head in agreement.
You are still sad that Polly isn't her true self...
But at least the parrot you love isn't gone forever.
You arrive at Polly's home once more. She's come a long way.
She's not as bubbly as she was before, but that was a mask.
The real her is quite down-to-earth and intelligent.
You think of how strong she has been throughout this time.
Harpy
Polly/Pauline
"Hey, sweet-tea! I have something to show you!"
"Close your eyes, no peeking!"
*She waits until your eyes are shut tight*
*After some rustling:* "OK, open!"
You open your eyes. Polly is wearing two new things:
A tape-on, orange beak, and a parrot-feather hat.
The way it's designed, she looks almost like a parrot!
All that would be missing would be to...
You've got it! You tell Polly you have a surprise, too.
But you haven't bought it yet, so just wait here.
You rush to the nearest party shop.
This place has become like a second home to you by now.
You buy a few different items and run back to Polly.
She's still standing where you left her, shocked.
You show her the bag of stuff, and what's inside...
Various different colors of body paint spray.
Polly squeals in joy, and the two of you start painting her.
At the end, her house-nest is a colorful mess, but Polly?
...She's an absolutely GORGEOUS parrot.
You stand back and gaze proudly at the two of you's work.
Polly-The-Parrot
Polly
*Polly looks at you giddily*
*SQUAAAAAWWWWWK!!!* "Thank you!"
*BRAAAAAAAAAAAWWWWWWWWWK!* "Pretty-face!"
*She rushes out into the streets*
You follow Polly as she runs through the toward the exit.
The other Harpies are staring and rolling their eyes.
Neither of you care. THIS was pure bliss and happiness.
Polly reaches the exit, grabs you, and takes flight.
After spending the day soaring through the skies...
You head home, feeling like you could take on the world.
You couldn't even describe with words how you felt.
Polly... there's no one else like her!
Polly-The-Parrot
Polly
*SQUAWWK!* "Polly knows, Polly knows!"
*BRAWWK!* "You're seeing others, indeed!"
*SQUARK!* "Polly knows you love her too!"
*BRAWRK!* "So she doesn't mind, not at all!"
Polly-The-Parrot
Polly
*SQUAWWK!* "Polly knows, Polly knows!"
*BRAWWK!* "You're seeing others, indeed!"
*SQUARK!* "Polly knows you love her too!"
*BRAWRK!* "So she doesn't mind, not at all!"
Polly-The-Parrot
Polly
*SQUAWWK!* "Polly knows, Polly knows!"
*BRAWWK!* "You're seeing others, indeed!"
*SQUARK!* "Polly knows you love her too!"
*BRAWRK!* "So she doesn't mind, not at all!"
Polly-The-Parrot
Polly
*SQUAWWK!* "Polly knows, Polly knows!"
*BRAWWK!* "You're seeing others, indeed!"
*SQUARK!* "Polly knows you love her too!"
*BRAWRK!* "So she doesn't mind, not at all!"
Polly-The-Parrot
Polly
*SQUAWWK!* "Polly knows, Polly knows!"
*BRAWWK!* "You want to see others, yes indeed!"
*SQUARK!* "Polly knows you love her too!"
*BRAWRK!* "So she doesn't mind, not at all!"
